answers.answer: It can be common for diabetics to have blood pressure issues- more commonly high, but sometimes low as well.  Here's a list of somethings that can be used to treat low blood pressure- it's good to get your doctors take on what you should be doing and what might be contributing to the low blood pressure, it's important to identify the exact cause.• Drinking more fluids• Adding more salt to your diet• Avoiding or limiting alcohol• Wearing compression stockings• Taking certain medicines, such as fludrocortisone or midodrine (Orvaten)• Going very slowly from a sitting to a standing positionHope that is helpful!

question: I am suffering from low blood pressure and my sugar level is normal and sometimes goes up little bit . I am asking about reasons that make my pressure low and is diabetes has big impact on it?!
title: Relation between blood pressure and sugar!
